RESOURCE.STRING: Fuel System Leakage Test
This is a manual test used to pressurize the fuel system which allows for operator assisted diagnostics.

Initial Conditions
1. No active fault codes
2. Vehicle stationary
3. Engine running at idle
Steps
1. Select Start
2. Check for fuel leaks from injectors, rail pressure relief valve, fuel pump, and fuel lines
3. Select Stop to end the test
Additional Information
1. This test will increase fuel rail pressure to the same level used at rated power
2. By increasing fuel rail pressure, certain types of fuel system leaks will be easier to find
3. External leaks and return flows from the injectors, rail pressure relief valve, and fuel pump can be checked with this test
4. Refer to the Troubleshooting and Repair Manual for this engine for specifications
Name
Value
Units
Warning: This test operates the fuel system at a high fuel pressure. Wear safety glasses and stay clear from the engine when running this test.
Once the measurement is complete, turn off the engine and measure the amount of fluid in the graduated cylinder. Isolate one cylinder at a time and compare the test results between cylinders.
Test has stopped because Vehicle Speed has been detected. Please ensure the vehicle is stationary and restart the test.
High Engine Speed detected.
High Fuel Pressure detected.
The test has been aborted for an unknown reason.
An unknown error has occurred.
The Fuel System Leakage Test has been stopped. The above parameters reflect the state of the engine at the time the test was stopped.

STRING.Context: Displayed when Feature Enable precondition fails

RESOURCE.STRING: <ErrorInfo><ErrorNumber>20119</ErrorNumber><Description>ECM calibration does not support this test.</Description><Suggestion></Suggestion></ErrorInfo>

<ErrorInfo><ErrorNumber>20120</ErrorNumber><Description>The test was not started because 1139 or 1141 or 1142 or 1143 or 1144 or 1145 or 1146 is active.</Description><Suggestion>Inactivate the mentioned fault codes and try running the test again.</Suggestion></ErrorInfo>

<ErrorInfo><ErrorNumber>20121</ErrorNumber><Description>The test was aborted because the Engine Speed was less than 600 RPM.</Description><Suggestion>Please increase engine speed and try running the test again.</Suggestion></ErrorInfo>
